constituent: elephant, colour, color, bound up, sow, pig
heisigStory: A rabbit's head with the body of a sow represents an elephant. Little wonder that the kanji also means "phenomenon"!
koohiiStory1: An elephant has huge ears, like a rabbit, and a big, fat body, like a sow.
koohiiStory2: An animal with huge ears like a rabbit, and a body fat like a pig... ¡An ELEPHANT! For the "phenomenon" connotation you could use Dumbo, or Joseph Merrick (the "elephant man") ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Merrick ).
readingExamples: 象徴 (しょうちょう), 対象 (たいしょう), 現象 (げんしょう)
